0

0
    {

        if (supportedAtoms[i] == atom)

509
0
    }

511
0
    return None;
512
0

// Check whether the running window manager is EWMH-compliant
515
//
516
static void detectEWMH(void)
517
0
{
518
    // First we read the _NET_SUPPORTING_WM_CHECK property on the root window
519
520
0
    Window* windowFromRoot = NULL;
521
0
    if (!_glfwGetWindowPropertyX11(_glfw.x11.root,
522
0
                                   _glfw.x11.NET_SUPPORTING_WM_CHECK,
523
0
                                   XA_WINDOW,
524
0
                                   (unsigned char**) &windowFromRoot))
525
0
    {
526
0
        return;
527
0
    }
528
529
0
    _glfwGrabErrorHandlerX11();
530
531
    // If it exists, it should be the XID of a top-level window
532
    // Then we look for the same property on that window
533
534
0
    Window* windowFromChild = NULL;
535
0
    if (!_glfwGetWindowPropertyX11(*windowFromRoot,
536
0
                                   _glfw.x11.NET_SUPPORTING_WM_CHECK,
537
0
                                   XA_WINDOW,
538
0
                                   (unsigned char**) &windowFromChild))
539
0
    {
540
0
        XFree(windowFromRoot);
541
0
        return;
542
0
    }
543
544
0
    _glfwReleaseErrorHandlerX11();
545
546
    // If the property exists, it should contain the XID of the window
547
548
0
    if (*windowFromRoot != *windowFromChild)
549
0
    {
550
0
        XFree(windowFromRoot);
551
0
        XFree(windowFromChild);
552
0
        return;
553
0
    }
554
555
0
    XFree(windowFromRoot);
556
0
    XFree(windowFromChild);
557
558
    // We are now fairly sure that an EWMH-compliant WM is currently running
559
    // We can now start querying the WM about what features it supports by
560
    // looking in the _NET_SUPPORTED property on the root window
561
    // It should contain a list of supported EWMH protocol and state atoms
562
563
0
    Atom* supportedAtoms = NULL;
564
0
    const unsigned long atomCount =
565
0
        _glfwGetWindowPropertyX11(_glfw.x11.root,
566
0
                                  _glfw.x11.NET_SUPPORTED,
567
0
                                  XA_ATOM,
568
0
                                  (unsigned char**) &supportedAtoms);
569
570
    // See which of the atoms we support that are supported by the WM
571
572
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_STATE =
573
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_STATE");
574
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_STATE_ABOVE =
575
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_STATE_ABOVE");
576
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_STATE_FULLSCREEN =
577
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_STATE_FULLSCREEN");
578
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_VERT =
579
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_VERT");
580
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_HORZ =
581
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_HORZ");
582
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_STATE_DEMANDS_ATTENTION =
583
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_STATE_DEMANDS_ATTENTION");
584

    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS =
585

        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS");
586
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE =
587
0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE");
588
0
    _glfw.x11.NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_NORMAL =

0
        getAtomIfSupported(supportedAtoms, atomCount, "_NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_NORMAL");

    _glfw.x11.NET_WORKAREA =

// Retrieve system content scale via folklore heuristics
993
//
994
static void getSystemContentScale(float* xscale, float* yscale)
995
0
{
996
    // Start by assuming the default X11 DPI
997
    // NOTE: Some desktop environments (KDE) may remove the Xft.dpi field when it
998
    //       would be set to 96, so assume that is the case if we cannot find it
999
0
    float xdpi = 96.f, ydpi = 96.f;
1000
1001
    // NOTE: Basing the scale on Xft.dpi where available should provide the most
1002
    //       consistent user experience (matches Qt, Gtk, etc), although not
1003
    //       always the most accurate one
1004
0
    char* rms = XResourceManagerString(_glfw.x11.display);
1005
0
    if (rms)
1006
0
    {
1007
0
        XrmDatabase db = XrmGetStringDatabase(rms);
1008
0
        if (db)
1009
0
        {
1010
0
            XrmValue value;
1011
0
            char* type = NULL;
1012
1013
0
            if (XrmGetResource(db, "Xft.dpi", "Xft.Dpi", &type, &value))
1014
0
            {
1015
0
                if (type && strcmp(type, "String") == 0)
1016
0
                    xdpi = ydpi = atof(value.addr);
1017
0
            }
1018
1019
0
            XrmDestroyDatabase(db);
1020
0
        }
1021
0
    }
1022
1023
0
    *xscale = xdpi / 96.f;
1024
0
    *yscale = ydpi / 96.f;
1025
0
}

//

0

0

0

1058
0
                        strerror(errno));

1060
0

1061
1062
0
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)

0
    {
1064
0
        const int sf = fcntl(_glfw.x11.emptyEventPipe[i], F_GETFL, 0);
1065
0
        const int df = fcntl(_glfw.x11.emptyEventPipe[i], F_GETFD, 0);
1066
1067
0

0
            fcntl(_glfw.x11.emptyEventPipe[i], F_SETFL, sf | O_NONBLOCK) == -1 ||
1069
0

1073

1075
0
        }
1076
0
    }
1077
1078

// Creates a native cursor object from the specified image and hotspot
1128
//
1129
Cursor _glfwCreateNativeCursorX11(const GLFWimage* image, int xhot, int yhot)
1130
0
{
1131
0
    Cursor cursor;
1132
1133
0
    if (!_glfw.x11.xcursor.handle)
1134
0
        return None;
1135
1136
0
    XcursorImage* native = XcursorImageCreate(image->width, image->height);
1137
0
    if (native == NULL)
1138
0
        return None;
1139
1140
0
    native->xhot = xhot;
1141
0
    native->yhot = yhot;
1142
1143
0
    unsigned char* source = (unsigned char*) image->pixels;
1144
0
    XcursorPixel* target = native->pixels;
1145
1146
0
    for (int i = 0;  i < image->width * image->height;  i++, target++, source += 4)
1147
0
    {
1148
0
        unsigned int alpha = source[3];
1149
1150
0
        *target = (alpha << 24) |
1151
0
                  ((unsigned char) ((source[0] * alpha) / 255) << 16) |
1152
0
                  ((unsigned char) ((source[1] * alpha) / 255) <<  8) |
1153
0
                  ((unsigned char) ((source[2] * alpha) / 255) <<  0);
1154
0
    }
1155
1156
0
    cursor = XcursorImageLoadCursor(_glfw.x11.display, native);
1157
0
    XcursorImageDestroy(native);
1158
1159
0
    return cursor;
1160
0
}
